fields.title: Interstellar
fields.review: A bold, beautiful cosmic adventure story with a touch of the surreal and the dreamlike.

fields.title: Spencer
fields.review: The movie is a bit much to take. It's oppressive, which fits the subject matter, so I get that. But it's also very one note, and worst, it doesn't make Princess Diana come alive as a person or character.

fields.title: Elizabeth
fields.review: Creative, respectful, enjoyable and touching. Well done.

fields.title: The Boy in Striped Pyjamas
fields.review: This movie is not as much about the Holocaust but about human emotions, about the innocence of children, why the grace and good nature of women is taking care of this world, the monster in every men and how life can be a Frankenstein.

fields.title: Dunkirk
fields.review: Christopher Nolan's largely bloodless but profoundly harrowing war epic is the best film he's ever made. Masterful visual storytelling on an epic scale

fields.title: Inception
fields.review: Inception is such a mind‑blowing, storytelling masterpiece and Christopher Nolan's 1# film while also being one of the greatest science fiction action movies ever made

fields.title: Train to Busan
fields.review: It’s a great action flick, it’s paced well so it has your attention drawn throughout and the end is somewhat emotional.

fields.title: Munich - The Edge of War
fields.review: World War 2 films have always intrigued viewers, especially younger ones as they look to experience how such a global conflict impacted the lives of people during that time. “Munich-The Edge of War” may not appeal to everyone, especially viewers looking for spectacle and action as normally is the case with World War 2 films. Instead, this belongs to the lexicon of more restrained, realistic and psychological war dramas like “Oslo” (2021) and “The Imitation Game” (2014) where the impact of the war on the protagonists is depicted in fine detail rather than the event itself.

fields.title: Valkyrie
fields.review: Definitely in my top 10, not overly actiony, the plot is very close to what happen and all the plot points are fleshed out. As a history buff it's a good movie that's not overly historical and still has it's good tense scenes. Shows Nazi Germany as it mostly was, not all germans supported the war crimes and crimes against humanity,  alot of regular germans actual wasn't to aware of that part and this movie shows one of the plots to overthrow the axis of evil.

fields.title: Anastasia
fields.review: I love the movie because it was based on the true story about the great Anatasia of Romanov royal family during the Russian Revolution.
